titleStmt.title: H. R. Sillett to James F. Robinson
CWG7821

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Hopkinsville Ky
Decr 4 1862
To His Excellency Gov Robertson
Governor of Ky
Dr Sir

There is a vacancy in the Office of Justice of the Peace in District No 6 caused by the death of R W Henry Also in District No 10 caused by the removal of Joe P Pool Also in District No 8 caused by the resignation of Joab Clark whose resignation is inclosed herewith

P. W. Dryden in place of Henry in District No 6 Willis Johnson in place of Pool in District No 10 And William Brown in place of Clark in District No 8 would be very suitable persons to appoint to fill said vacancies They are all good Union men & Loyal Citizens & men of sufficient information & intelligence in fact among the best citizens of the County & their appointments would give satisfaction in their Districts & if appointed will accept

Yours respectfully
H R Sillett
County Judge of Christian County

Christian Co
J P.
Dist No 6. 8. 10
Appd Decr 10 1862
